summary: Good coverage for grill and charcoal box......

reviewText: This is very cheap. You get what you pay for. This hold bird seed but I'm not sure how long it will last.
Very nice looking bird feeder.  Only concern is seed getting wet during winter.  Was given away as gift, person liked.

$300 is a lot for what you get, but it did work very well for me last summer.  it caught lots of bugs and I noticed a difference.  Sadly, this year, it won't even start up.  Poor quality really annoys me more than the bugs do.  Grrrr.
summary: Worked great first year.  won't work this year.

reviewText: I bought this at a great price, and awaited eagerly by the mailbox for nine days. Finally, it came. I was overjoyed at first, but then dismayed to discover that the handle was all bent up! So I returned it in exchange for another. After seventeen days of agonizing anticipation, it arrived. And guess what? The handle was twisted on this one too! So I sent it back, and now after nineteen days camping out by my mailbox, this one is also deformed and out of shape! I'm going to exchange it, and if I get another defective one, I'm going to get really mad!
Still working very powerful
It was easy to install, and has kept the squirrels away from the feeders.  I would recommend it for anyone who has birdfeeders.

only used a few times but seemed to do the trick. tried of replacing the small tanks. refills about 80% full. make sure the larger tank is warm (placed in sun) and small tank put in cooler for a while seems to fill tanks better.Does not fill small tank 100% so that is why 4 stars but if you go through alot of disposable tanks a great investment. would buy again and amazon by far had the cheapest price.

We have been buying smokers for about 18 yrs now.  Most don't last more than a season before they collapse and disintegrate.  These are holding up very very well.  They're more heavy duty than the other stainless steel smokers--but they're not as heavy and cumbersome as the cast iron smokers.  We're quite pleased with the product.

I wanted something that would make the clean up process better and easier, but because of the broom handle's low height, it ended up hurting my back to use it and cause far too much strain. I'm 5'7", however... a friend of mine who is 6'3" willingly accepted it as a gift.
summary: I didn't like this at all

reviewText: Used to limit ground squirrell population on property.  It appears to be working as described and will most likey use again.
This air filter is the perfect replacement for a stock Honda Ruckus. Quality and fitment are perfect, and I couldn't ask for anything more.
extremely handy tool, especially for cutting small and medium sized tree limbs.  very easy to operate and makes it easy to cut many limbs in a short period of time.
I was surprised at how easy it was to lop off branches with this. Very nice unit and seems to be well constructed. It also weighs less than I expected, but still seems strong and solidly built.
summary: Surprised at how easy it was

reviewText: successful watering can that is child-sized. it's blue, as described. it's metal, as described. when you pick it up, it becomes portable.
summary: holds water and empties water when desired.

reviewText: Just as expected. All is perfect. They are strong, lightweight and well painted. We're glad to have them ready for next Spring.
Very effective product,Love it!!Killed every nasty roach in site!Would recommend it to everyone.I tried everything else and spent tons of money and this stuff is by far the best!

This product worked from day one even though I had a small problem trying to figure how to bait the trap. It would be helpful if they gave a little more instruction on the best way to make sure the bait is properly placed. Initially, I was just placing sunflower seeds on the ground and placing the trap over the seeds. That worked fine until one little guy decided it wasn't a good idea to step on the trigger even though there were plenty of seeds beyond it. He/she actually ate all of the seed I put down four times before I finally got smart enough to attach some seeds with peanut butter to the trigger itself. He wasn't smart enough to figure that out. It also might be helpful if there were more holes on the top of the trap in order to bait it without moving it.Other than that, it works wonderfully. I have gotten rid of fourteen, have not seen any more, and my wife is happy that they are still alive and living in a new community 2 miles away.
Be sure you measure the length and with of what you are replacing. Also, this isn't very thick so it might be uncomfortable.

I have had this for about a week and have been using it everyday. So far, it's doing fine, however by examining the product I get a scary feeling that it won't last very long  due to the reviews and examining the material of this product. Yes, it is hard plastic but hard plastic like this product can be easily crack on the cement by accidentally dropping it.  The design of this product I would give it a 3-star. Nothing to brag about it except for the slick and monstrous design it shows. I'm afraid to use this nozzle as a normal everyday-used nozzle because of the material it uses. I have to be very careful of not  dropping this nozzle, however my first modification, I've modify it by placing a weather-proof strip molding inside both of the dipping (where the Made in Italy) hole were, to raise it up so that when I do drop it- it will protect the upper part of the nozzle by those strips. My second modification is that I've installed a plastic ring just around the quick-connect ( the orange part) so it will protect the lower part of this nozzle when drop, because it's raise.(hopefully) Both upper and lower part of this nozzle is protected by my modification when is drop. I'm hoping that it will help last the life of this nozzle. Good luck!!!
I like the cast construction and comfortable handles.  I use this as a scoop in the fertilizer and potting soil bags.

This thing wrangled in several hundred flies over a few weeks.  Made a long-lasting impact too - the fly population was very noticeably decreased throughout the end of summer.Just be advised that it really smells *horrible* (maybe 15 feet diameter from bag?), and flies that have not yet entered the bag hover around it (the contents inside attract the flies to the bag but it's still incumbent upon each bug to actually go inside)So keep away from people or areas where people congregate (e.g. grills, patios, play areas).
summary: Def. works -- but keep it far away from your stuff

reviewText: i bought some turban covers a long time ago from a home improvement company that was going out of business and once i used them everyone wanted to know where i purchased them. this is the first time i've been able to buy some in years. they last a long long time and i love them. they are much better than the usual plastic covers you can buy anywhere.

It was hard to find what flower this was after seeing this at a friends house. I finally identified it and from one packet have been saving seeds for a few years now and it's all over my yard. Great fall colors and attracts birds, bees and sometimes hummingbirds.
and has not killed any more...not sure why?  ONly issue I have is it sucks up a lot of battery power and you have to tend to it...wish they had a DC power option.
summary: ONly killed one mouse in the attic....

reviewText: Been using this for years. It's sometimes hard to find in local stores (they don't seem to order a lot to keep in stock). So I decided to buy online.

The straps buckles were a big disappointment to me like others have stated.  They simply do not hold the straps tight and thus the shoes keep coming off.  My solution was to replace the proved buckle with one inch plastic quick snap buckles like you find on a day pack.  These stay tight and I can walk all over my lawn for an hour or so and they never come lose and slip off.  I used the one inch straps  that came with the shoes.

I purched a 24-inch Leaf rake in the past but it broke in two pieces.  I ordered a replacement which arrived today and it said it is unbreakable.  What is your replacement policy. The first rake was also purchased from Amazon.com
It is not large but enough to spray more than 30 pots on the patio. Good pressure. I have had it for several months, so far so good, very happy with it.

This cart is the best buy I've made in a long time.  It is easy to move even in tight spaces; it is quiet, so I can move heavy garden pots early in the morning without disturbing my neighbors.  It was easy to put together and when I ran into a bit of a snag, one phone call, answered immediately, put me right on track.  So far it has helped me rehabilitate a large pot garden I have in my driveway.  To move the pots I need to cross a section of lawn and the broad wheels don't make tracks.  The next project is a redo of the back yard; I just know that my EZ Cart will be right there hauling, moving, etc. After that, I plan to redo my bedroom; with a quick washoff I will use it there to move the contents of room to holding area. I am VERY satisfied with my EZ Cart and will recommend it to all my friends.

Used this pocket saw for the first time today to cut a limb off a crab apple. It's very sharp, easy to hold and handle. Blade folds and closes for easy portability. This saw was recommended by a professional landscaper/tree pruner.  Glad I got.

We are a very patriotic family and have a regular flag pole. While the current flag may be good for a while longer, we want to be ready to replace it as needed. This one appears to be very sturdy; a good buy, too.

I bought this hose reel for my wife for Christmas because of the excellent customer reviews on Amazon.com.  I broke a couple of plastic tabs on the swivel and their customer service replaced them right away.  This company actually stands behind their products, something we see to little of anymore.  Thanks, Scott at Rapid Reel.
summary: Great hose reel with excellent customer service

reviewText: This product works fine. No bees or ants, only hummingbirds.I recommend this product to everyone and I received this product very fast in Brazil.

When my two year old Orbit H2O broke, I decided to get the NAAN. It is a great sprinkler, quiet and easy to adjust. Much better than the impulse and oscillating sprinklers I have had over the years. It is easy to operate, because it does not have many settings. There are only two - distance and area. I missed the various settings of the H2O and called Orbit's service department whether I can fix it. No, I cannot fix it, but when did I buy it? 2 years ago. No problem, it is still under warranty and they sent me a brand new head. I now have my favorite sprinkler back again with all the various settings that I like. How great is that?

I have two of these and love them.  So nice not to have to premix chemicals and put them in a pump sprayer.Great for spraying chemicals on lawn. I also put straight bleach in the tank and spray in at the hightest mix rate to get rid of mold and mildew on the side of my house.ONly wish they made a smaller resivoir to use when i am only spraying a small area.
I've used Fiskars for years. I actually had the handle detach from the trowel once, but that was after several years of very hard use. Good product for the price.

I've had a few chainsaws over the years and was very hesitant to switch from my stihl - but I have no qualms about it now. This is an excellent chainsaw for smaller jobs and performs great. I read a couple reviews that mentioned difficulty with cold starting the chainsaw - but I have had zero issues with the chainsaw at all. Starts right up every time and gets straight to work with no hesitation.

This has really saved me so much money! It works great! I also had issues with the battery but then I noticed that if it is not all the way put together IE: the top that covers the metal plates are not on the light wont light up to indicate that it is working. The trap has caught several mice and is still working great, doesn't bother the cats or dogs but if they play with it they can open it easily so be careful. My cats just usually ignore it tho! This will save you so much money on mouse traps tho so I would recommend getting this.

I like this product, but I'll be switching to MaxiGrow the next time I buy nutrients.  Dry is more potent/cheaper, so I'll use up the rest of this bottle.  Overall, I've been very pleased with how these nutes have worked, and would recommend them to anyone looking for liquid nutrients for hydroponics or otherwise.
summary: Works great, but dry might be better

reviewText: I replaced the .065 line with the .080, to try to get better life and performance out of it. So far,so good. the line itself does seem to hold up better than the original size, so I must have figured correctly.
the chairs are great but they didnt send the hardware for 2 of the chairs so they are sitting useless in the garage and I dont know how to contact the company to get the hardware
This provides exactly the helping hand I needed while doing yard work.  Excellent quality.
this small trimmer meets all of my needs for small jobs.  It has a lengthy charge and stays right in there.
Works great, seriously under estimated the real length of it, does reach the hard to get to spots on my single level home, no pressure loss at all

This product could not have been better.  It is a perfect fit for the taskmaster power washer we bought locally.  In this era of one part breaks and finding you have to just toss the working part; this was a perfect solution.  It came with many adaptors to help it fit most any power washer unit.  Very glad I thought to check on Amazon, once again, finding exactly what I was looking for.

Turned our RoadTrip grill into a cook stove for camping. Purchased 2 stove grates. Allowed us to use 2 very large pots on the grill to cook spaghetti and sauce for a crowd. Works out better than regular camping cookstove when cooking for a crowd because you can fit 2 larger pots on the this grill. Definitely highly recommend. Because of the large aluminum grill and these stove grates, we have all of our camp cooking needs covered.

I've purchased these (but not from Amazon).  This price is too high.  Solutions catalog has for $6.50 each.  I live in northern Michigan & have never been able to grow poppies from seed OR purchased already started plants.  I simply pressed these into the ground halfway, kept moist (in the spring), & by early summer I had poppies, poppies everywhere.  All types, & they have re-seeded for the past 3 years.  I'm sold!!
although birds have not nested in it as of yet it adds a sense of whimsicle to my backyard and very well constructed.

Pool company $880.00 Amazon less than half and 20  inutes of my time. I dont know why any body would ever buy anything anywhere else. With free shipping and the best satisfaction of all NO SALES TAX it cant be beat. Also the return policy and reputation exceeds that of and brick and mortar store and all other online retailers. Amazon is no risk. This pump is an exact replacement and fit and ran flawlessly. Again 20  inutes to install.Thanks Amazon.

I really like this fire pit.  I think it is attractive and durable.  6 months ago I had purchased a $60 model at *arget and I am grateful that I got this one.  I let my husband put it together and he had no trouble as he is good with putting things together.  It is much more heavy than my last pit and much sweeter to look at.  I like the cover, make sure you have let it cool down before you put it on.  We have it on solid stone so we haven't had a rust issue yet.

The filter works well and is easy to install. My only problem was a cracked pedestal base. And I can see why it happened. The packaging is very poor and the main tank beats the base during shipping. However, Amazon paid me for a replacement ($50) so it worked out fine. Shipping was reasonably fast. It only took about one week even though I opted for the "free" shipping.The multi-port valve plumbing was completely different from my old filter (StaRite) and I had to re-plumb the pump inlet, outlet and waste ports. I used 150 lbs of Zeobrite instead of 300 lbs of sand because the Zeo has finer filtering characteristics. The filter comes with a new pressure gauge which seems to be a cut above in quality. The site glass in the multi-port head is nice for viewing the dirty water when backwashing. I had to use a lot of teflon tape on the 1 1/2" port threads or they would leak. Seems like the threads may be straight and the PVC parts at the hardware stores are slightly tapered. The filter has been in use for one month and so far, no problems.  With the exception of the base, everything appears to be of high quality construction.

We see hummingbirds but they won't feed from the feeder.  They won't even try to drink.  What can I do? It's hanging from my lemon tree and  I've moved it around but they still won't drink.  I'm very upset!
summary: Have not attracted a single hummer!

reviewText: I choose this for use metal detecting as our state parks limit you to a shovel no wider than 2 inches. This fit the bill perfectly and has been a wonderful tool to use.

This is a great water hammock.  It was quick and easy to inflate the outer ring.  It allows you to float submerged in the pool, which is great for the extra, extra hot days we have in Palm Springs.  It is very comfortable.  The only improvement I'd recommend is a cupholder!
Pretty straightforward product. Apply power and it opens.  I wasn't able to find one of these locally so I ordered it here.  Works well and no complaints.
summary: Did exactly what it's supposed to do.

reviewText: My bad - listen to the poor workmanship comments - they are real. The warranty they claim will not be honored - spoke to the company directly. It should be illegal to sell junk to the public. Mine worked for less than 1 week, made the mistake of buying two. Now I have 2 nice paperweights that cost a lot of money. I suggest staying away from any product from this company.

I am unsure of the plant quality yet. However ... there are only 3 seed pods in this pack and 4 spacers. The first gal at the company told me to contact Amazon. No, I said this is your product they are simply acting as a middle man. I told her I would like to speak to someone above her. She says her supervisor is "tied up" but will call me in a few minutes. 45 mins later I call back only to reach a sarcastic supervisor on the other end. Watch out doing business with this company. Too bad really.
summary: The Company With NO customer service skills!

reviewText: Nice sturdy stand for my Mantis.  It doesn't like to stay in the down position when the tiller is sitting there idling but for fueling and other times with engine off it is great to have.  I highly recommend
Good quality and it rolls the hose easily without too much effort.  Keeps it neat and untangled.  It also swivels so you can go in any direction.

This was my first Cold Steel purchase and I must say that I am impressed!! The weight and balance of the Kukri feels great in the hand, and the quality of the blade seems to be exceptional, only time will tell.Why four stars and not five?The blade was not sharpened at all. I researched for a couple weeks before I pulled the trigger, and there seemed to be mixed reviews on the sharpness of the blade; some said it was the sharpest blade they have ever pulled from the box, while others said it wasn't sharp at all. Mine was the latter...no biggie I would have taken a sharpener to it either way, but I've never had a blade this dull out of the box, unless it was a free knife at some trade show.The second reason for 4 stars and not 5. They place a big COLD STEEL sticker directly on the blade, that left residue on the blade after attempting to peel it off. Not a huge deal, but constructive criticism.All in all, it is a great knife/machete for the dollar and I am very happy with my purchase!!
This item is too large for a small spa. Also, the plastic band around the bottom to control the amount of chemical dispensed fell off quickly and could not be repaired.
summary: Too large for a spa. Fell apart quickly.

reviewText: The smoker works by advancing small wood-chip pucks onto a heating element.  But the advancing mechanism gets stuck because the tar or other sticky stuff build up seems to jam to mechanism so you get 20 minutes of smoke.  If you want more smoke, you have to go and tend to the smoker and insert another wood puck manually, which defeats the purpose of buying an electric smoker.  And the heating element is barely enough to smoke the wood.  It has never gotten hot enough cook anything.

Purchased (for $9.98) along with theFire Sense Hammer Tone Bronze Commercial Patio Heater(as a "lightning deal" for $123.85) ... fits with extra room to spare. Covered the patio heater using the head cover with and without the two-piece metal rod inserted along zipper - easier to throw over heater and secure with rod(s) in place. Looks good - quality is not bad - on/off performs without much problem (although you have to open the zipper fully to easily put it on and sometimes the string attached to the zipper [used to help zip/unzip the cover once in place] stays up on top of heater head when placing the cover on requiring me to get up on a chair or something to retrive the string and zip up the cover).  I like how it looks once installed. Appears to protect the head from elements and debris/bugs as advertised. I like the velcro strap (1" x 4") near bottom of zipper and once neatly secured, I take strings attached to zipper and wrap once around patio heater pole and tie - this helps to firmly secure the cover to the heater itself. I can see how wing nuts on top of heater head securing the reflector pan might damage the cover over time - cover is not heavy duty material but soft thin vinyl with thin white felt-like backing on inside. All in all - for purchase price of $9.98 - GET THIS item !
Save your money. This trimmer is too light weight. Will not trim limber sprouts. The blades are very thin and don't seem to cut very well.

These came quickly, seems like they are made of good quality metal.  Only downside which is hard to avoid I guess is they are covered in machine grease when they first arrive.  Ive given them a good scrubbing and next time I grill something ill throw the skewers on the bbq to burn off whatever is left.

Bought for my daughter who got a mouse in her house.  These things must work, because she said she nevet saw it again after plugging these in.  We did a lot of fast research & found that these are the safest & most humane form of pest control.  That was important because at the time, my grand-daughter was crawling.  Poisoning & traps were just too dangerous around a crawling baby.  This turned out to be an excellent solution & thankfully, no more mice.  They also must not bother dogs at all because my daughter has a 90 pound dog who never seemed to notice they were plugged in.
The device came in record time and works great!  Thanks a lot.  I will definitely check back to this site as I need to.

These are great tongs. They're made of stainless steel, and they have soft grip handles. They're very sturdy. The locking/unlocking feature works great. And the long handle (17 inches) make these tongs very useful.

I bought this only because it was the only small watering can my local nursery had at the time (they were out of stock of anything else).  I don't really need the "pour & store" spout -- how much space does that really save you?Anyway - it started leaking from the joint between the can body and the spout almost right away.  So I basically had to carry it around with a dishrag wrapped around the joint to keep from leaking all over the floor.  And six months after purchase the o-rings that are in the joint have disintegrated and broken.  This with pretty minimal usage (once a week and I often did not even turn the spout into the "store" mode).Now the can is useless.  I will try to permanently seal the joint with some silicone sealant.  I don't care if it's locked in one position.  The "Pour & Store" is a gimmick anyway.I hope others had a better experience.

This saw cuts through tree limbs so incredibly fast - it is unreal.  I have a ~35 fully size pine trees on my property, and I always reach for this saw when I need it.  I have small electric powered chainsaw too, but honestly this Corona hand-saw cuts through 3, 4, 5 and 6-inch diameter limbs so quickly with such a small amount of effort that I hardly ever reach for the chainsaw.  It cuts on both the push and pull strokes to double the cutting speed, and the curved action really helps the forward and back strokes "catch" even better.  On the forward stroke, the back part of the blade closest to the handle really digs in, and then on the backward stroke, the curve makes the front teeth on the blade really dig in.  I have had mine for about 4 years, and can't tell you how much use it has gotten all-the-while the blade seems as sharp as the day I got it, and I have done no maintenance to it whatsoever.  I've never sharpened the teeth, and I have given this thing a beating and it hasn't declined in performance at all!  Even with pine sap along the side of the blade, this thing hasn't had the slightest amount of rust anywhere on it.  It looks like I will probably get another 20 years out of this incredible saw, as it's holding up better than I could have ever imagined.Seriously, it's 20-seconds and probably 20 full strokes to rip through a 4-inch diameter limb.It travels so well too.  It is as light as just 1 pound probably.  I kept the cardboard blade cover.  You can grab this saw and walk around the yard with hardly even noticing that you're carrying it.  The shape makes it well balanced, and it isn't awkward at all while climbing ladders.I have used it cutting for hours straight, regularly just throwing it to the ground after a cut, and the red handle makes it so easy to find among the cut brush.
summary: This Corona Clipper Saw Rips Through Limbs

reviewText: Perfect glove for everything..I work in greenhouse and use these gloves for making wreaths for the holidays,,,they allow you to feel what your doing and protect your hands as well. Very light and comfortable.

I've been using this product for at least a decade. You clear the area of weeds first, apply by sprinkling the grains, then lightly water. Depending on rainfall it lasts 3-4 months. Do wish they could make it last 6 months since here in the Midwest it sometimes gets warm in March or early April; if applied then, one would have to put down another application in July or so. The label lists the plants around which it can be used: the list is very long. I usually put it in and around my hedge, flowers, lilac and forsythia bushes, tomato and bell pepper plants as well as along the fence. It saves a lot of work.
Works great for veggies.  keeps the veggies hot and cooks them quickly. This is our second Wilton grill tray. Love it
The blower is fairly easy to change from leaf blower to vacuum usage. It has plenty of air velocity even at the minimum setting.

We have a large urban deer population in our neighborhood.  We had a landscaper put down "deer resistant" plants only to see everything get munched to the ground (we were in a severe drought).  18 months later I decide to put in some fresh plants.  He gave me some of this stuff.The plants have been in the ground for 4 days now.  Not only are there no munchings on any of the plants but there have been no deer even come into the vicinity of where I sprayed.I'm going to spray the perimeter of my backyard and see if I can just keep the deer out based on that.Pros:Best product on the marketCons.Temporary smell
This really helps make picking up the raked leaves easier.  Feel like there is more control than when we use 2 rakes.
summary: Makes picking up leaves so much easier.

reviewText: We seem to get mosquito's year round (No Cal. Bay Area with many vineyards nearby) and purchased this product last fall. It seems to do a great job in catching tons of fruit flies and a fair amount of mosquito's - not too bad on the "good" bugs. The radius from which it attracts seems to be less than the claimed 1/2 acre but I can't verify that...seems like I might need to add a couple more units to knock out the mosquito's completely. Very quiet operation and the bulbs have been going 24/7 for over 6 months and still working. The only drawback to this unit is the catchment method - to empty the unit (as noted by another reviewer) turn it off and place it tightly in a plastic bag over for 24 hours - otherwise any live ones will start flying out! A solid 4 Rating.
summary: Good Solution for Catching Flying Bugs

reviewText: I had been looking for a cart bigger than the standard small model but smaller than the standard big model. This was it. But it is not quite as large as the listing says, those dimensions are the size of the shipping box! Take off about an inch for length and width. We are using the cart to move railroad tie landscaping barriers (170 lbs each) around the back yard. It does that with ease. I wouldn't call anything on this cart is flimsy. It is sturdy, maneuverable and versatile. All four of the tires required additional air pressure which can only be done with a manual pump per the users manual. But I used my electric emergency tire pump from the trunk of my car. Just keep in mind that due to the low volume of air in the tires they fill up fast - don't go to the gas station! There is a little confusion about the correct psi for the tires (manual says one thing and tires sidewall says another). Use the lower. Shipping box arrived in OK condition, not perfect. But there were no parts missing. Assembly takes awhile (and more tools than the manual states - screw driver and plyers aren't going to get the job done). Ratchet set needed if you don't want a "repetitive motion injury"! But beyond all of that, its a good cart.Recommended by us!Enjoy

I love this ottoman. They look elegant and I like that they are big. I bought two and they look nice with the other Strathwood furniture, lounge chair and round ice bucket table. They seem good quality for the price.

Best cover I ever owned for a Grill in all my years of BBQ'n. I have a 64" COSTCO Stainless Steel grill that's about 12 years old. I recently refurbished the entire grill with parts I found on Amazon, and it is better than new. It works so well, I felt bad leaving it out in the elements (which I've done for the past 6 years). I opted for the 70" rather than the 64" so the corners don't get stressed and rip over time. With the elastic adjustment along the bottom it looks like it was custom made for my grill.With the "Prime" shipping, I got it just in time to protect it from monsoon-like rain! You can't find a better cover for the price!!!
summary: Heavy Duty Cover without the Heavy duty Price!

reviewText: Generous fit!  I don't like being forced to review in 18 words.  I don't HAVE  to respond to your request!

This is not your everyday, run of the mill, BBQ cover. I've been through a bunch that have either torn or blown away. This cover is made of Quality, Heavy Duty materials the likes of which I have not seen from other manufacturers. This one is made to last! And you will be happy to know that there are tie downs that snap together easily to the base of your BBQ and pull ties that snug it up around the base. Size runs true to dimensions stated and there are handles at the top for easy take on or off. This one could very well outlast my grill. LOL

I bought the larger cover- the 60" for a 30" diameter fire pit as recommended by others. You definitely need the larger cover if you want to cover the dome top as well as the sides. So far it is doing the job, seems to be made well of quality material. Have only been using it for 2 months, so I can't comment on durability.
These are great and look nice! I ordered two.
There really isn't anything to say about the items I ordered. Just general parts for a generator. The shipping time was excellent though.
the opening on the Plexiglas sides is too  large allowing a lot of waste and spillage . This is with sunflower seeds .

I did a lot of research before buying a roll of weed block.  This one got good reviews.  So far I am very happy. I do NOT like weeding flower beds.  It's been several months and very little weeds escape through this cloth.

This is a well made feeder.  I love how the feeder pulls out from the bottom - very cool.  It holds a lot of seed as well. The squirrels have not been a problem.  Remember though, my bird feeding friends: Sometimes you have to feed the squirrels too to keep them away from any feeder.  They're cute; so feed them too!

I put out these traps and soon heard the snap and then squealing.  The first two mice were caught but not killed.  One had his side caught and the other his back leg.  They both ran dragging the trap along while squeaking loudly.  Set the traps again and two more caught, this time both died.  Next day two more caught, one by the tail, and one by the back leg, both alive.  If you intend for this product to kill on impact you will not be pleased at the result.  If you want catch and release, it is a matter of chance.
Have had it up since fall. Will see if bats come this spring. Seems something has been chewing or pecking at edges. May need a screen for bats to cling to. Will see.
I broke all the rules. No experience. Smoked a brisket first time out. Superb!! The smokenator works like a charm. I love good ole American ingenuity and product construction.

I had large patches of St. Augustine grass that had died in late summer (for some unknown reason).  This rye grass grew quickly, and covered the patches well.  It survived long enough for the St. Augustine to recover in the spring/summer of the next year.  I would recommend it.

I ordered this product and at the same time ordered the Black Flag Insecticide. Well the machine got here a week before the Insecticide, so we had to wait. And we also had to go out and try and find the right can of Propane. Then we followed the directions it did fog etc. but the flies came back after 2 hours, it was pain to wait for all 3 key elements to arrive at the same time, Propane, Black Flag and Machine and then it did not work. We tried again the next day more aggressively and it was worse the flies did not even go away. We do not get a refund on the Black Flag. We ended up buying a pop up tent and netting so we can enjoy the back yard without the flying bugs etc. what a waste of my time and a disappointment.
summary: I had hoped it would work well but I had to return it

reviewText: Great Product. I was able to add to my New Wall box and add in all the breakers thatI wanted to for emergency operation.
summary: Installed and does what it promised

reviewText: Or so I found out after moving here from the upper mid-west.Works good and as advertised. Arrived in prompt fashion. My only suggestion would be a better way to put two of the 10'X20' together OR make a 20'X20' So I can cover my citrus trees easier.
summary: Even Fla. has frost and freezes.

reviewText: This was just what I wanted.  I left on vacation for a week & it held the water until I returned.  It also is very attractive and an eye catcher in front of my large Living Room window.

This really works, better than anything I have tried. Weed, then sprinkle. It really does form a barrier that prevents anything else from seeding as long as you don't disturb the area with further digging.  Amazing. Seriously.
So handy to be able to order a large quantity for such such a good price. With three suet feeders, we are likely to run out so having many in reserve is wonderful. The birds love this product!

The fire pit has been a nice addition to my patio during the december chill.  It's used frequently and appears to be holding up well.  My only problem is the screen appears to weaken when used during the fire and becomes mis-shapen.  it is also starting to rust.  All in all a good investment for the use it's getting.

Unit arrived with broken spark plug.  I purchased a new one per instructions from the supplier.  After much effort it started and seemed to work OK. Tried to start it 2 weeks later - no dice. I'm getting a lot of exercise trying to start it.
summary: Looks Great - Can't get it to work

reviewText: I bought two of these a year and half ago (one for lights, the other darks for $17.56 each) and they are still going strong. Tall and slender for my space, it fits a great amount of clothing. Check the size for your use and do not get them wet as one reviewer mentioned it doesn't go back to it's original form. I recommend this to anyone.
summary: A Year and a Half Later: Great

reviewText: I just wanted to say this is the perfect solution for people who aren't in the snow removal business, but need a plow to clear a driveway more than 30 feet. Easy to install, easy to use, pushes snow 6 to 8 inches deep down a 1,300 foot drive without any issues.  I've used it for two winters now and can't say ANYTHING bad about it. I not only use it on my drive, but honestly look for neighbors and friends to plow out every time it snows. You can't beat the price, it's durable, not overly heavy and it pushes snow without fail. If you can't afford a $4,000 plow, or have a vehicle that really can't hold the weight of one of those hydraulic beasts, shoot even if you have the money and a 1 ton truck, this is the plow for you!
I have consistently good results when using Earth Box.Replant Kit has all the components I need to add to potting mix when starting new plants.
Belt is holding up very well. Has been in use for over a month now and use the mower about 3-4 hours a week to cut grass. Would get this again.

I had a plastic flavor injector that only lasted through a couple of uses before I had problems with the plunger coming apart, and after the fifth use it broke all together.  Someone recommended a stainless steel flavor injector so I started looking around.  This one was a bit expensive but I figured that it would last longer.  I am very happy with it so far - it is so sturdy that I can't ever imagine it breaking.  I love that it comes with both the solid and liquid injectors. It's easy to switch between the two, and it's very simple to take apart for cleaning.  The extra cost is worth it- don't waste your money on plastic injectors!  Highly recommended.As far as the usefulness of the product itself- these flavor injectors make a huge difference in the quality of the food.  I've used them for turkeys, picnic ham/pulled pork, and whole chickens, and every time I use it the meat turns out very flavorful and perfectly cooked.  It helps prevent the meat from drying out while cooking.  I will use it for every dish if I can.Just a note about the seller, Grady's Online- they are a bit slow. It took them four business days to ship my package, and it was first class so it took another week to arrive.  A positive experience otherwise, but if you think you're going to need this item you should buy it now rather than wait until the last minute.
summary: Don't waste your money on plastic

reviewText: We used several of these to cover the azaleas in our back yard. The nets have held up through the winter weather including several snows. The deer have not been able to dine on our azaleas this winter!

You don't see tool like this around much.  It's so easy to split the smaller logs with one blow with this, and larger ones by using it as a wedge.  Love the fact that you can hammer into a moderate/large log to set it up as a wedge.  It's heavy, so doing a lot of small kindling tires your hands in short order.  Comes moderately sharp.  Great tool for the money.

I read the reviews and thought I'd try it.  I was diagnosed with a form of Lymes disease (Eurlichia) last summer and I'll be damned if I get it again.  I know Deet isn't the safest chemical to use but I'm not risking it.  I though this would do the trick, but I have to say I'm hesitant to use it due to the awful smell.  I sprayed it on my arm to try and was surprised.  It not only felt like spray paint on my skin but smelled like spray paint.  Kind of like tarnish that you put over wood to preserve it.  I have a very sensitive nose and this smell stayed with me all day even after i washed it off with soap and water.I probably will not use it and may just use it to varnish my outdoor furniture, lol.
summary: It may work well but can't get past the smell

reviewText: These helped my sloggers fit perfectly.  I had to order a half size larger and with the aid of this insoles, they now fit perfectly and are very comfortable.
4/5. Good Container for disposing off Biological wastes. However I wish there was a solid rim around the inner diameter of the container to tuck the plastic waste bag.

We use these in a Kitchen Aid Trash Compactor and they fit as well as any other.  They hold the contents and do not leak, unless someone crushes glass and it punctures the bag, but even the high cost bags from local stores can't take that abuse.  Considering the cost to go to the store and pay more ... these are real bargain.  Will buy again ... and again ...
I bought this to replace a broken timer in a T104M; replacement took about 15 minutes and was less than half the price of replacing the whole unit.
Takes a few attempts before you figure out exactly how much is the right amount to go in the smoker. Could be helpful if they came in bigger bags.
summary: They work and not bad for the price

reviewText: You will probably be better off buying the shorter pre-made soaker hoses at Home Depot.  The stuff at Home Depot works out to be cheaper since it has the connectors, and it has a 7 year warranty instead of the 30 days here.  After 40 days I found a split hose with this stuff from Amazon.
summary: Went out to my garden this morning and found a split hose

reviewText: Back in 2009 I posted a negative review on this product because the plank and my food burned to a crisp. I have since learned how to use the planks and I want to post this retraction. Here's the trick.1. Soak the plank for at least an hours completely submerged.2. Cook on indirect heat (burners off directly under the plank)Sorry for leaving my old review up for so long. This product works fine if you know how to use it!
It was a bit cheezier than I thought that it would be, and my house still has not sold :(

This was purchased as a gift for a friends anniversary.  They saw ours (not a Coleman) and loved it.  We bought this one hoping it was as good as the one we own.  It was better than that !!!  This one actually has stakes at the feet for stabilization that we all thought was a bonus.  Smooth lowering and raising and no tipping of the grill make this the perfect brat grill !!!!If we ever need another one, this is the one.

Purchased these for my 8yr old nephew.Within 18 days the first egg case hatched.He was totally thrilled, as were the adults I might add.Approximately 2 weeks later, the second case hatched.The egg cases came with a paper bag hatching habitat, and instructionson how to assist in the hatching. However I purchased a larger, net habitatsuitable for raising butterflies so he could watch the baby mantis.There were hundreds of them! Feeding the mantis, the few weeks we kept them,was interesting, but well worth it. They were absolutely amazing!
We loved this for first few weeks. Killed fruit and regular flies very easily, but then stopped working for no reason.
summary: Worked great for 3 weeks then died

reviewText: have had three of these things, not one has made it an entire year. if its not electrical its cheap plastic. whish i could post video on here, i have cameras on my house and caught video of this thing falling apart with no wind and exposing live electrical wires. do not buy!

Here in Portland the river rock at 14" was impenetrable barrier for these. Great idea for forest soil? Farm? I ended up ripping off the split washers (screw part) and just sledge them in. They do what they are designed to do but not with gravel layers.
summary: Don't bother unless you are on farm dirt

reviewText: I received the machine and did not try to start it up for a couple of days. When I did it would not start because the recoil was smashed and the throttle was all bent. I do not blame the vendor, but I do blame UPS and Troy-Bilt with the way they package the unit. Otherwise after repairing the unit myself it functions fine.

I've tried it all - Insecticides killed the ants on the surface but they quickly returned. The granular baits didn't work, the ants would just walk by and ignore the granules. The ant stakes were totally useless. I figured, why not, I'll try these interesting looking liquid baits. Within minutes of putting the bait down the ants were lined up feeding on the liquid. The first day there wasn't much of a change, the second day the ants were reduced by half, and today, the third day they are GONE! Not a single ant! It is truly an amazing product!
Who knew there was a Patchouli plant!  I love it.  I love the smell of Patchouli.  I have it all over my home.  Spray, incense, shampoo, conditioner, body wash.  Perfect plant for my home!

I love this hose.  The product is exactly what I was hoping for.  It is convenient to use and the sprayer works great as well. The only thing I want to mention is that even at 50 ft if you have a large area, it may not be enough.  But for me, this length is fine

This is the second time I have purchased this mower.  the first mower was purchased eight years ago and gave excellent service.  It is a fine choice for small lawns.  The new mower appears to be virtually identical to the mower I purchased in 1999.
summary: Black & Decker cordless electric lawn mower

reviewText: I have a decent size yard, more than 1/3 acre, and a lot of things to trim around. I have owned this Troy bilt cordless trimmer for almost 6 years and it has worked flawlessly. I did have to replace the battery once but it is an off the shelf battery that I picked up at a battery store. Quick story, when the battery died, I went looking for a replacement trimmer but could not find the Troy bilt (Which I had bought at Lowes) and so bought a "WORX WG150 at Sears. I had figured that going to an 18 volt trimmer would be an improvement, but it was not. The Worx cordless trimmer just did not have the power that the Troy bilt had, and although I did like the automatic feed on the Worx trimmer it was just not powerful enough to get the job done. I strongly recommend the Troy-Bilt TB55 and am confident that most will find it to be an excellent replacement to their gas Trimmer.

This sprayer is similar to one I had used before.  It performed very well from day one.I use it once a week to spray my 100 hybrid tea roses with fugicides and fertilizers.  One four gallon mix is enought to cover all my roses very well.
I intended to but bonsai pots, not plastic bonsai containers... but here I am.  They're nice plastic bonsai containers, though.  Lesson: learned.  I will read more carefully in the future.

I live in the city and was looking for a feeder that I could use that would make me feel less urban-like.  I will admit that it took about two weeks before the birds (sparrows, mostly) felt comfortable enough to use the feeder.  I lured them with seed just sprinkled on the sill.  Now, birds are frequent visitors throughout the day.  I have had no problems with the feeder suction cups or with rain getting in the feeder.  A very good value feeder.
summary: Great little window feeder that's perfect for apartments!

reviewText: Purchased two of these to monitor the UTH for my two cages. I actually plugged these in and put them in the center of my home first to see how correct the temp readings would be. They both were within .5-1 degree difference and in my opinion work perfect for the price you pay. I would recommend these to anyone needing an on/off thermostat to monitor your reptiles heat source.

This is a very helpful and useful tool for the all around maintenance of bonsai. From pruning and pinching to repotting and scraping a trunk/branch to create deadwood, you'll find a variety of ways to use this tool. What I probably use it most often for is pinching out of new growth on some junipers and cleaning out dead growth from the inner parts of my trees. Get this.
They are working fine, looks like a good product. I use my spa about 1-2 times a week. Filters are not complicated so I expect no problems

The nutrition product for plants was highly recommended to me. It is easy to use.  I am trying it and will see in a month or so whether it is good for my house plants which have never been fertilized!

My husband and I were both very pleased with our Hirt's tomatoes! They arrived healthy and strong and are doing beautifully. Our only issue is that we were supposed to receive 4 plants and we only received 3.

These Safer Sticky Stakes do a great and better job of catching flying insects than any other sticky traps for plants that I've tried (and I've tried them all).Problem is, it's an add on-item, there are  7 traps and 7 stakes. Fill the traps, buy again, and you've got 7 new traps and 14 stakes. Fill the traps and buy again, and you've got 7 new traps and 21 stakes.The stakes are made of molded plastic, Safer doesn't offer the traps alone, so the plastic stakes end up in the landfill. Not an organic product, to say the least.
summary: Does a great job of catching flying insets, but isn't a great value...

reviewText: Does the job.
I was not sure from the picture if the product I was ordering was the right size, but it was.  I was very happy with the quality and the price too.  It was exactly what I wanted and needed.

THIS ITEM LOOKED GREAT UPON DELIVERY.  HOWEVER, 7 MONTHS LATER.  THIS HAMMOCK IS DISINEGRATING.  LITERALLY BREAKING APART IN PIECES AND ROTTING.  I HAVE NEVER SEEN A HAMMOCK, FALL APART LIKE THIS IN SUCH A SHORT PERIOD OF TIME. I WENT TO LAY OUTSIDE IN THE SUN TODAY - STRINGS BROKE AND I WAS COVERED IN BLACK SPECS OF NYLON.  I GOT UP AND SHOOK OFF THE HAMMOCK.  THERE WAS A PILE OF VERY FINE BLACK NYLON MATERIAL ON THE GROUND.  I CLOSELY EXAMINED THE MATERIAL AND IT IS ROTTING, DISINEGRATING IN MY HANDS AS I HELD IT. CALLED AMAZON CUSTOMER SERVICE - WE WILL SEE THE OUTCOME.

I just received it. I haven't used it yet. But I can tell the thin metal thread won't go trough the clay terrain here in Houston, it may the first couple of holes. It looks was designed to dig soft soils. I am not sure if ship it back now, or give a chance and use it.
Color is more like Camel and it wasn't as thick as I was expecting. Also it says 6 feet x 15. It came only 2 feet by 6 feet.

Comes as grey foam not the green like the original had, I'm not sure about how it will hold up but it should be ok and fits my Woodshark. If your saw is older check your fuel lines mine were all rotted except inside the tank, highly recommend Tygon tubing if you replace the fuel lines, you'll need 2 sizes to do the job and a filter.
Hammock spreads too much,  it would have to be hung too high for the average person. I should have ordered one with solid fabric . Caution on expansion should be on specs .
CHEAPLY MADE.  I BENT IT THE FIRST TIME I USED IT.  THE END PIECE IS MADE OF VERY THIN METAL AND IS EASILY BENT WHILE SCRAPPING.

I just picked up one of these to keep my ATV in and wish I had done it a year ago instead of contemplating it.  I had been concerned about wind and snow but after setting this up I am very confident in the design.  The auger anchors are a great feature for securing it to the ground and the ratchet system for the cover keeps it very tight to prevent caving in.  The overall length of my ATV is about 6 1/2 feet so it pushes the front and rear panels out a bit but it still zippers fine.  For the money, this is a great alternative to an expensive, permanent structure.
summary: If you are debating this, just do it

reviewText: Does the job. Warms the pool. Keeps debris out without having to use the cumbersome cover that came with the pool.

I'm pleased with this item so far.  The only complaint is that it's a bit short and comes within about a foot or foot-and-a-half of the ground on my grill.  I don't consider my grill to be exceptionally high.  Other than that, the fabric is heavy and the quality seems good. We'll see how it holds up this winter.
summary: A Bit Short But Works Well

reviewText: I ordered this to hang my hummingbird feeder from the porch roof. Looks good and sturdy, will see how it works this spring.

High-rise apartment buildings in NYC: Roaches are everywhere, and the Bugzooka sucks them up even faster than they can run. After you fill the canister, you can easily deposit the roaches into their new home; the toilet bowl.Homes in the country: Spiders are everywhere, indoors and outdoors. I should have a holster for this because I carry it all over, and any spider I see is easily captured within a few seconds, without any mess. And if I see two, three, six, whatever, they are all sucked into their little cage match where they fight until they are released into their new home; the toilet bowl.My Bugzooka has been the most used and useful products in years, it completely fills a void in any household.
summary: Like transporting bugs straight to the sewer. Flush.

reviewText: No where in the description on Amazon do they state this is a Debris cover. The item pictured is not what you get when you order this product.  I wish I would have read the reviews of this product before I purchased it I would have never bought it, I could have went to the local Flea Market and purchased a 15 X 15 tarp and my money would have been better spent.

As for being a weeder as advertised, it's excellent!I like it so much I ordered another one when I pushed it beyond it's limits and snapped it in half.I use it to get my needed depth of 12" of loosened soil beneath new vegetable transplants. It's great for that but don't go prying too hard to pop out stones etc. less it might snap.
Easy to put on and I haven't found a slug in my garden since!  Before putting on the tape I was removing at least 10 slugs a day, so I'm glad the problem has been taken care of!

More cheap plastic parts that do not hold up. This is an obvious problem with this chain saw, yet they sold them anyway instead of fixing the problem. They lost a customer for life. I will NEVER buy any product from this company again.

We use the bins for storing bird food in the garage and they are perfect. They hold twenty pound bags of food without a problem and stack solidly.  The ones we had previously were not as strong as these nor did they seem as stable when stacked.

Trying to break up our heavy clay soil is no easy chore. Not only is it naturally dense clay, but the previous owner of our property used a big riding mower to tend the lawn, compacting everything down even more.This digging fork makes it possible. From the downright comfortable handle (seriously, find one in a store and give it a try, it just fits in your hand perfectly) to the sturdy shaft to the sharp tines, breaking apart the nearly impenetrable ground is going about as fast as i could expect without power tools.It's as good for breaking up the clay as it is for mixing in compost and other soil amendments. This tool has made my gardening life vastly easier.
I  think that these work great for BBQ and to illuminate a dark door when needed. They last a long time with simple battery replacement

The shelter logic canopies are great.  We don't have enough lot width for a permanent carport type of structure, so the canopy keeps our new van covered and gives a lot of protection from weather.  Our canopy sits between our house and the 7 foot fence of the neighbors and so even keeps it from freezing.  We have left water bottles in the van (accidentally)  and they will be really cold but not frozen when the weather is well below freezing.  Thanks,  it is a solution to our "garage" problems.  Incidentally,  we now have 2 of them one in front of the other so that both vehicles are protected.

arrived very quickly, and very green, on the small sidebut very healthy, i am letting it stay in original pot for a few weeks indoors to get stronger for the outdoorsgreat seller, good productsBUY FROM THIS SELLER, GOOD PEOPLE
Love it so far. Used to protect my garden. Works so far. I used to spray with my own concoction which worked fine but I had to spray after every heavy rain.
summary: YARD GUARD ANSWER TO MY PROBLEM SO FAR

reviewText: The door on mine will not stay closed from the top. Way too expensive for the cheap quality, not worth the return costs. I'm done with Suncast products.Extremely disappointed. DO NOY BUY.
summary: Quality sucks.. Not worth the money.

reviewText: I agree with all those who went before me.  This Yard Butler saves my knees and is a big help in getting up and down.

Not only did this product arrive in a zillion pieces, but there was no stand to attach it to.If there had been a skinny wire stand as pictured, that probably would have held up for a whole week, before the wind knocked down this top-heavy breakable design.Pretty color, but that is all it has going for it. Not practical.
this is the most simplest trap to set. just place over tunnel and step on it. also the only trap that i have used that really works
They arrived quickly and in lovely packaging. I am waiting for them to come up, and I recommend this seller to anyone with much enthusiasm.
summary: Beautiful presentation. Thank you so much!

reviewText: I love the design of this feeder!  It incorporates functionality with the decorative design.  See those leaves in the photo?  When a squirrel attempts to climb on the feeder, the outer casing slides down with the squirrel's weight and the leaves cover the holes to the seed access.  It doesn't keep the squirrels from trying, of course, but they can't hang on the feeder and eat up all the seed, which is exactly what I need in my neck of the woods!
hmmmm. slow growing ,i guess. wish they would grow allready! not one sprout yet?..so, will be great when they grow?.

This is the second time we have purchased this plant stand.  It is easy to put together, all of the holes line up correctly for the screws.  We have been using the first plant stand set we purchased for about a year.  The plants are watered as they sit on the stand, and despite the water the finish continues to look good.  The stand is stable and keeps our potted plants looking neat.  We like that the lowest shelf is high enough to protect the plants from raiding rabbits.  The only problem we've had is on the second set we purchased there is a broken weld on one of the decorative arches at the bottom of one of the shelves, though it doesn't really affect the stand's stability. Otherwise they are great!

This is the second one I have purchased. One for the deck and one for the patio by the pool. These  storage boxes are  sturdy,easy to  move and hold alot of stuff. I use it to store the chair cushions ( 6 of them)  the lanterns 3 of them , filter media for the pond filter ,some misc items and still have plenty of room left over!! I can put a table cloth over the top and use it to hold extra  dishes when having a picnic on the deck. At the pool I use to for chair cushions,pool tools and  toys, lanterns, and extra towels. It is plenty big enough without taking up too much room. Thanks to my Grandson I discovered  they will also hold a small child when playing hide and seek!!:) Highly recomend
Arrived quickly.. will plant in January. My children and I love heirloom tomatoes, and I look forward to trying this one out.
summary: Arrived quickly, healthy viable appearing seeds.. will update

reviewText: built this by myself yesterday. i am a short woman over 65 yrs and i had to modify the way i put it together, but it was still easy to modify.  it seems sturdy.  all the parts were included.  roses look beautiful on the arch.  my ground was pretty soft and sandy as well as uneven, but i still think it will be steady and hold up nicely.  my roses are happy.

This is a great little tool to have.  It's so easy to just walk through the yard and pick up pecans, not a back breaking task anymore!  It's reasonably priced and does the job! It also works for hickory nuts.
Good Garden Tools. I long time was looking for one like this is. Thanks for this. I recommended it for every gardener.

I bought the small shallow trug at the feed store to use as a water bucket for mini-horses. When I got it home I found it was perfect for mixing and carrying horse feed. It's lighter than a bucket and has more comfortable handles.Since I add hot water to the feed it is better than a bucket because it flexes so it fits in the sink, and is soft so it does not scratch. I can think of a dozen uses for this product and plan to buy more for organizing and storing.
summary: A trug of many positive attributes

reviewText: THE SELLER IS SUCH A JOKE JUST LIKE THE PRODUCT.  IT BROKE AFTER USING IT TWICE.  I GOT IT FOR MY SONS BIRTHDAY IT TOOK SO LONG TO GET HERE THEN IT BROKE WHAT A PILE

The plants came up fine. I just do not know what type they really are? i can not tell if male or female and not sure of the exact breed of plant. i would have liked to have more info, i did however lose them in the terrible cold single digit temps we have had , and so i will try again in a few weeks to get more growing. A little more info about the type of Kiwi is all i would ask, and this is why i gave them 4 stars instead of 5.

I used to try to keep our hot tub bromine balanced by adding some each week, but I'd always forget and it would end up disappating completely.  Now with the spa frog floating system, I use the mineral cartridge (open all the way) and set the bromine cartridge set to 1...just enough to keep the bromine level perfect.  Used this way, the bromine cartridge lasts for quite a while. Between the two, I don't worry about the water being unsanitary, and even if the bromine cartridge runs out, the minerals will keep the water clean for a little while by itself.  Now the water is always ready when we want to use the hot tub.
Good for the money. Gets the job done for the most part. Works good near salt water and in wet sand

Purchased my Snow Joe in February 2010 after the first big hit from Snowmageddon in DC. I've used this blower about 3 times to clear a bunch of parking spaces and sidewalks for myself and my neighbors after heavy storms. I was excited to use it again after the fist real snowfall of the season happened on 1/27.I managed to clear out 5 parking spaces and sidewalks for 5 houses before it broke. The culprit? A BRITTLE PLASTIC PULLEY!! This cheap manufacturing was already mentioned in another review and SnowJoe has a 2-year warranty and they're sending me out a replacement, but this basically means you might only get two seasons of use from this machine thanks to cheap parts.All in all, I don't regret the purchase, but if I had to do it again I'd probably spend a little bit more for a sturdier product.
Purchased this case for my 18' Poulan Pro Chainsaw. It actually was shipped direct from the Poulan factory in North Carolina. This case is the OEM case and is high quality, highly recommend.
The B&D leaf hog has a bit more power but the ease of changing from vac to blower more than makes up for it.  Mulches very well.
summary: Pretty good machine for the price.

reviewText: The Sunbelt ground cover weed barrier is great for controlling unwanted weeds.  I have placed it on the bank of a ditch which was always unsightly and no weeds have emerged plus it looks very neat.

I have never made a liquid fertilizer with this - I mix it into the top few inches of soil.  This stuff is more than just a plant food, it has beneficial bacteria and my peppers, tomatoes, herbs and lettuce love it.  Ordering another bag to get me through the summer...
summary: AMAZING results in my urban garden

reviewText: Living in the Bay area, we don't get harsh elements but I wanted something to keep our heat lamp in decent shape through it's off season.  This cover does that nicely.  Only con is my husband thinks this thing looks absurd sitting on our deck, but my heat lamp in in great shape!
This is a very pretty feeder. It was a gift for someone who lives in an area with a large hummingbird population and everyone really likes it.

I've had my zero gravity chair for a few days now, and every time I sit down the first thing that comes to mind is how this chair is not designed for tall people. I'm about 6'4" and even with my head a fraction of an inch below the top bar my feet and ankles are hanging over the bottom bar. This is extremely uncomfortable.I also had to add lumbar support to the chair because, like I said, it was not designed with a tall person in mind. So it does not support your back like it should.Finally, the flimsy locking rings under the arm rests are made for a certain weight distribution, tall people with their feet hanging over the edge are putting more weight on the bottom side than the chair was designed for. Slight movements put too much strain on the locks and they slip making a grinding clicking noise.Bottom line, if you're over 6' tall this is probably not a good option for you unless you plan on modifying the lumbar support and ankle support like it looks I'm going to have to do.
summary: Not for people over 6 feet tall

reviewText: The chairs are quite large.  And the seat cushions were too big for me.I replaced the chair cushions with other more comfortable cushions.
summary: They are pretty, but not comfortable.

reviewText: I purchased this blower from amazon and could not be more pleased. I had an old homelite blower that was hard to start and was not very powerful. This ryobi blower is very easy and quick to start and has plenty of power and is not too loud I have had other gas blowers that are much louder. It is pretty lightweight and makes cleaning up my acre of land a breeze. It looked almost brand new out of the box with just a few scratches on the bottom. All the accessories were new and included. reviewText: After buying the Strathwood set of 2 arm chairs, I had to have this 2-seater to go with them.  They all come with cushions making them very comfortable seating.

I purchased this grill primarily to cook salmon, an easy item to over cook.  This especially in that I prefer mine rare but hot and my wife prefers hers medium-rare.  After learning the grill's characteristics it became easy to control the "doneness."The controls are good but the starting instructions less so.  Paraphrasing the instructions I understand to: "Turn the control knob to `start' and push the igniter button.  If it doesn't ignite within 5 seconds, go through a re-start procedure."  I find it should read: "Turn the control knob to `start', after 5 seconds push the igniter button.Also,I like the grill's appearance and think that it cleans up easily.
Order these throw drip pans for my bar b q grille. They are good for what are. I will wash them a couple of times and  then replace them.

This light works great and really illuminates the grill surface.  Mounting instructions are a little confusing as the show handle examples and let you determine the one that looks like your grill.  Illustrations would be  better if they told you the handle was in the open or closed position.  Screws provided were rather cheap and stripped out after several attempts to mount.  Otherwise, this is a super addition and allows us to grill after dark without the aid of a third hand to hold the flashlight.

Well worth the money to go from the ceramic grates, which had started to sag in the middle, to these grates.  They are heavy duty and seem to hold the heat well and give a constant temp better than the ceramic ones.  I replaced the burners, flavorizer and the grates and it feels like I have a completely new grill.

I've cooked about three times with the rotisserie and it worked perfect. I really like the on and off switch to stop the rotisserie while checking if the item is cooked to the right temp. Will worth the money and very will built.
I was so pleased to find the part at Amazon and at such a reasonable price.  Was very easy to install.  It works perfectly.  Thank you.

Be advised that if your existing burner tubes are less than ten years old, you can get them replaced for free by going directly to Weber customer service and sending pictures of your rusted out burner tubes (even the cross-over tube).  My cross-over tube was rusted out badly but the main tubes were still in pretty good shape. Some places sell the cross-over tube by itself but it costs the same for the same price as the complete set. I didn't think that Weber would replace just the crossover tube so I ordered the complete set through Amazon. Later I contacted Weber directly and guess what...they sent me a complete set of tubes for free (thank you Weber).  I figure I'll just keep this set as a spare for when the new ones from Weber rust through in about six more years. As for the scoring, I figure if the crossover tube doesn't last for the length of the warranty then it can't be a five star product....however...Weber customer service deserves all five stars.

First off, this is a great grill for the price. You will get a top-of-the-line product that has pleased us very much when it comes to grilling. Unfortunately, when assembling the grill, a few (minor and cosmetic) parts were missing from the packaging. I called customer service and they promised that the missing pieces would be shipped shortly... A month passed. I contacted them again and they said it was on its way... another month passed. When I called this morning, I got the recording that they had declared bankruptcy and the product is no longer covered under warranty. Translated, this means that I am stuck with what I have. Fortunately, the grill is operable as is. I suppose if critical pieces were missing from your order Amazon would credit your account, but keep this in mind when ordering. It is an excellent product and certain to last a long time, assuming all parts are included...
summary: Great Grill - BUT company has declared bankruptcy

reviewText: We recently purchased the Outdoor Residential Controller with Cloud Technology and have been very impressed thus far with its capabilities.  Our reasoning for purchasing this controller is we have two homes.  Our primary home is on the east coast and the home we wanted to use the new controller on is in our residence in Arizona.  Our main purpose for such a controller was to have the ability for our landscaper to adjust our watering schedule on the fly and for us to monitor those changes remotely.  We also wanted the ability to know the amount of water our landscape uses.When we purchased the controller, we had only a week to install and test the unit before we needed to return to the east coast. We initially  tested the unit with the gateway indoors and it communicated perfectly.  However, once we placed the unit outside, made the connections and turned it on, the display failed.  We contacted Cyber-Rain and explained what happened and also told them that we were under a time crunch to  get the unit install along with a  flow sensor and test it before we left.  Due to the time crunch, they overnighted a new controller.  Their sales and support staff answered all questions on the flow sensor and the installation of the controller.The controller and flow sensor work just as we had hoped.  Our landscaper can program the watering needs of our shrubs and trees.  We can remotely check the water flow and usage, as well as how often our plants are being watered.  We are very pleased with our purchase and would highly recommend this controller.
summary: Cyber-Rain Outdoor Residential Controller w/Cloud Technology

Not a very pretty sight but better than the mess they were making.  Don't waste your money.

reviewText: This clear ~ solid round tube is all one piece and doesn't leak water inside so it's our favorite Finch feeder so far.The food stays dry and the birds like and use this feeder.The portals are designed for Finch mixes and thistle ~ and holds 1.3 qt or 1.6 lb of food.The portals are held together by a screw ~ 6 portals = 3 screws.When the screws are removed the portals come off, and also the bottom.The one piece tube is easy access with a bottle sponge/brush, but this doesn't need doneas often as some other Finch feeders we've tried because the inside of the tube stays dry.Footnote: Our least favorite Finch feeder ~ Garden-song ~ Classic Finch Feeder ~ large 1.5 lb thistle seed capacityThis feeder leaks water inside badly every time it rains.The reason is that the clear round tube that holds the seed is made in two partsand are held together by the screws that hold the portals and perches on.Because this seam can be pulled apart for cleaning and isn't sonic welded togetherwater constantly leaks inside in a short while. The food spoils and mildew'sNot only is this an exhausting waste of food, but the Finches won't eat the un-molded food at the top of the feeder either.
summary: Belle Fleur 15" Thistle Tube Bird Feeder ~ GREAT Product.

reviewText: I researched smokers for 2 weeks and narrowed it down to electric smokers.I have never smoked before,and when I picked up my Masterbuilt smoker from Walmart ( free shipping to local Walmart) I followed the super easy instructions,and did the 3 hr break in...I then smoked some pork ribs for 6 hrs ( 3 hrs, and wrap in tinfoil with some water in side for 3 hrs)they fall of the bone.Very easy to use plug in set temp,set timer put water in water tray,and drop in some wood chunks(everyone seems to always mention wood chips well the wood container is big enough to use wood chunks 6"x1"x1" they burn longer)and leave it alone. The only thing you have to do is refill the wood every 1.3hrs to 2hrs...Im smoking some pork shoulders next...I would highly recommend this to all who want a nicely constructed (not cheap)smoker for the money...Happy Smoking...Only thing I wish is if they would make the cord longer...I bought a lawn and garden wagon to haul from the garage to the back yard,I just leave it in the wagon while I smoke,works great...

Don't buy this blower if use ethanol gas. After 3 months of using blower gas began to leak. Since it was still under warranty I took the blower to an authorized service center. Low and behold it was deemed by Husqvarna to not be a warranted item since it was not a product defect, go figure.  $55.00 bucks later I have a blower that works but it was $55.00 more that I wanted to spend. I have used this product as well as other neem products on the market.  I prefer this one.  I get good results with this product and minimal results with the one I have bought at one of the big box stores.  You would think Neem is Neem but my theory is that the other products have the Neem diluted with so much soap you don't get the results.  I use 2 tbs (of the dyna-gro pure neem oil) per gallon of water, throw in a teaspoon of insecticidal soap or however much is needed to get it dissolved and you can see the difference in the shine on the leaves.  I don't get that shine with the other products.  That's all I have used this season and the garden is doing pretty well.  It was doing great before I tried the other neem and now I'm getting some fungus so I'm going back to the dyna-gro.  Hope it recovers.

reviewText: Trying to protect twenty high-bush blueberry bushes from catbirds, and we found this product mentioned in [...]The product description makes it sound as if you can select specific distress and predator calls for 22 species of birds, but that is just not true.  There are seven settings, none for catbirds.  We have tried using the setting labeled "general" and even though it is all set up according to directions, we have found the birds are very comfortable with the noises, which are just not that loud, and the final insult was finding it covered with blueberry-filled bird droppings.  The package states it comes with 100 ft of cord but the cord was barely 15 feet.  And it is not waterproof.What a huge waste of money, time and hopefulness!
summary: Does not deter catbirds, and is falsely advertised

Then another landscaper told me those are centipede grass. Finally, I searched the internet and I am pretty sure those are torpedo grass. There is no way to kill torpedo grass without harm other grass but to use ROUND UP to kill everything. I used Round Up a few times over 2 months with good success. Yes, my yard is very ugly now. Fall is here and I am re-seeding the yard now. The Scotts Southern Gold Tall Fescue Blend Grass Seed is giving me good result so far. I wish my yard is all green again next summer.Anyone knows how to kill torpedo grass without harming tall Fescue ?? Help ??
summary: Is that Bermuda grass, centipede grass, or torpedo grass ?

reviewText: The detector air tests at 7" on a quarter in discrimination with sensitivity maxed out. A little unstable in house, so I turned it down to sensitivity 6, & got 6" on a quarter in my air tests.I took it down to a school park where I usually do good and only got 2 shallow pennies. Thought maybe something was wrong with it, so I planted a penny down 3" and it picked it up loud and identified it correctly. I'm sure I'll do better with practice.It has a low tone for nickels, a medium tone for zinc cents, a high tone for 25c 50c and $1 coins. Copper pennies and dimes go back and forth between high & medium tones. Visual ID works OK, too. There is an approximate depth indicator. I use rechargeables for the 8 AA batteries it requires. Total weight about 3 lbs.Seems a great buy for $79.95 with 1 year warranty.
summary: Gold Century GC-1026 Pro Color metal detector
