This is an internet scam, going on ebay, amazon and other websites. Those people use software edited pictures to  make you believe there are double to triple desert rose.I've done research, those double or triple desert roses are not existed. If you search key words online, all you can see are closed up pictures of double or triple flowers with blur back ground. You will never find the picture of full plants in different angles . I also searched on Youtube, there are only videos playing sliding show of those closeup fake pictures, not one video show double or triple desert roses lively.Don't buy any this kind of seeds from anybody, doesn't matter it's online or in the stores, because when you finally find out it's not real, it's already months or year later, and you can not ask them for refund. And those thieves are counting on that.To the sellers, please upload a video to show me that you indeed have double to triple desert roses, thank you.
summary: Fake seed, there are not such kind of double or triple Desert Roses.

This thing is AWESOME!. I've been messing around with several different cold smoke generators and none of them really worked well. This thing works really super!  I wasted too much money and time on those other things.After following the directions to "season" the tube and burn off left over oil from manufacturing, I put a couple pounds of cheese in my Masterbuilt Electric smoker and the Tube Smoker in the bottom.  I filled the Tube Smoker half full of pellets and fired it up.I DID NOT use any heat from the smoker itself for this test.  In fact I never plugged it in. The cheese will melt at just over 100 deg (F).  I wanted to see how much heat the Tube Smoker would generate because I want to use it for cold smoking.  I have a larger barrel style smoker I normally use for cold smoking because the heat source is well away from the food to be smoked.  Trying it in this smaller unit was just a test.The pellets lasted about 2.5 hours (half full).  There was enough heat generated to cause the cheese to soften but not melt.  I didn't think to put a thermometer inside so I don't know the exact temp.If I were to use the Tube Smoker in a BBQ grill for example, I would make sure the food to be smoked was as low as possible and plenty of air flow.  It does generate too much heat for a small, closed in space for cold smoking.It would work great in a BBQ grill to add smoke to your food.  If you're cooking steak, burgers, chicken.  I like to throw a couple pieces of Tri Tip (tied together) on the rotisserie and add wood chips to the coals.  I plan  to use the Tube Smoker next time in the BBQ.This is a really wonderful product and for price and my needs, I prefer it over the A-MAZE-N Smoker.  That's the "maze" style, wood dust smoker.  Such a simple but useful idea.

I used to own a B&D; GH600 Grass Hog so I base my review of this trimmer in how it is better or worse than the GH600. This trimmer has more power and a better balance and feel. It is easier to switch from trimmer to edger than the GH600 and the telescoping shaft is nice. The GH600 had .065 line and I had hoped the .080 line on this trimmer would be much better and last longer. I am disappointed that it uses much more line than the GH600 did. If you let it hit the sidewalk or fence too much the spool will be empty before you know it. If you buy wound replacement spools they cost $ 7.50 each. I wind my own. 375 feet of high quality .080 line cost me $ 14.75. The GH600 had a wire guide to use when edging, this has a wheel. I don't like the wheel because if you don't watch it you'll be rolling the wheel right down the sidewalk with the line hitting the concrete all the way. The GH600 had a sturdy cord retention hook, this trimmer does not. The spool cap was easy to get off on the GH600, it is more difficult on this trimmer, to the point that I use a small screwdriver to push in on each side to release it. I don't totally dislike it but had hoped a newer design trimmer would be an overall improvement.After using it now for a few weeks I have to say I am really unhappy with it now. It uses too much line. I cannot recommend this trimmer. Wasted my money.
summary: An Honest Comparison -  Old Trimmer Was Better Than This One

I've used a few pressure washers, and work with a friend who owns a tow truck business. He builds and drives race cars on the weekends at the local dirt track. He has 4 of them. He and I talked several times and he went over and over about how "the Subaru engine" is so much better than the Honda. I thought that was odd, but he really USES his, all the time. He said that his 2 Honda-engine based pressure washers don't have the pressure of the Subaru, don't hold up to long hours of pressure washing and they aren't built nearly as well. I took his word for it and I'm glad I did.It starts easy. It is easy to fuel. It is easy to operate. It is extremely well built. It is well designed, easy to wheel around... you name it, this pressure washer does everything right.The Powerstroke pressure washer with the Subaru Engine is simply awesome.  Maybe TOO good. My wife tried it and got hooked on making things pretty Our driveway, our bricks, our neighbors walkway, her grandmothers driveway, her grandmothers bricks.  From my perspective at this point, I just add gas and get out of her way - the Pressure Washer does the rest. She loves it. I love it. I HIGHLY recommend it.

I was worried about purchasing these after I read some of the reviews, but figured I knew enough about plants and terra cotta to make them work :) First, I submerged the Plant Nanny in water and let it soak for an hour or so. Terra cotta absorbs a lot of water, and I figured if the stakes were already full of moisture when placed into the dirt, they would be less likely to pull in moisture from the bottles as quickly. Then, I gave my plants (I use these on tomato plants) a healthy watering - almost 2x as much as I normally would on a regular water - to really soak the soil. Then, I placed the Plant Nanny in the soil and attached the water bottle (I use the Smart Water bottles with the labels peeled off - they are pretty sleek-looking and unobtrusive, so they aren't super noticeable in my yard). Works perfectly! The bottle didn't release any water upon being placed in the Plant Nanny and has been (very) slowly releasing water in the days since. My tomatoes are the only plants not on drip irrigation and I was always forgetting to water them regularly. These have been a lifesaver!

This panel arrived safely packed.  Aluminum casing is very well made.  The MC4 connectors are very nice as well.I use a Tracer 4210 40 Amp MPPT charger (Renogy MPPT40CC).  On a UV 2 day, I get 34 V (12.2 Volts - 3 amps).  This was expected behavior.  When UV is 5, this panel puts out 36.7 V (12.4 Volts - 8.5 amps) 105 Watts!  Very nice.On a sunny 70 F degree day, I measured 98-106 F on the bottom of the panel.  This is with a 15 knot breeze and 2' of clearance under panel.  So plenty of cooling at my location (La Conner, WA, USA).I am using this with 6 golf cart batteries (660 Ah). They are configured as a 12 Volt house bank on a 45' trawler.  Will need 2-3 more of these panels to keep up with discharge and lower solar days.

reviewText: among other things this product is also used for rapid growth and it can be used to make your very own feminized seeds for your herb. This is not water soluble so you need to make a small mixture using 91% isopropyl alcohol then you can put your GA3 and iso alc mixture into a quart spray bottle or an industrial sprayer if you so desire. This product comes complete with instructions on how to use it and make a mixture, a measuring spoon and safety gloves. This is a very potent GA3 product. if using to make feminized seeds indoors i would recommend using a Paclobutrazol (bush load) product on the plant you intend to treat, this will keep your plant from growing out to tall and to lanky. GA3 will dramatically increase internode length and growth in treated branches/plants. it causes herb plants to hermaphrodite so be sure to only get it on the plant/branch you want treated
summary: great product great price fast shipping

Goal Zero is great a putting together comprehensive, easy to use solar solutions that actually work and this latest "Goal Zero 41022 Guide 10 Plus Solar Recharging Kit" is no exception.This is their smallest/lightest comprehensive kit thats great for hiking or camping or for an emergency bag.  Its primarily meant to help power or charge small mobile USB, AA or AAA devices like phones, small tablet computers, flashlights, radios etc and offers a great solution for those away from normal power sources beyond their devices battery life.It consists of:1) A Nomad 7 Solar panel.  This consists of two rigid 3.5 watt high efficiency solar panels in a sturdy folding ballistic nylon frame (kind of like a wallet but bigger) that contains the electronics and power connections along with a zippered mesh pouch on the back of one panel that can hold the rest of the kit and more.  The panel has a flap with a magnetic closure and several cord loops in various positions to allow you to hang or fasten the panel to something.2) The Gide 10 Plus Recharger.  This is a small plastic box that holds 4 NiMh Rechargeable AA batteries (included) (or 4 AAA batteries - not included) that can charge the batteries to accumulate and store the power from the solar panel, and then provide higher levels of consistent power to your USB devices.3) 4 AA Rechargeable 2300mah 1.2v NiMh Goal Zero branded batteries.  These have good capacity but as the instructions say to make sure to charge them every few months, they are likely not low self discharge (LSD) batteries like Sanyo Eneloops that can retain 75% of their charge after 3 years.4) An AAA adapter5) A 12v female cigarette lighter cable to allow the panel to directly power some 12 volt devicesEverything fits in the mesh compartment on the back of the solar panel and it forms a package about 7"x9"x1.5" and weighing about 1lb 11oz.  There's plenty of room left in the pouch for the USB cables of whatever devices you might want to charge/power with this kit, more batteries etc and you'll still likely end up under 2 pounds.So what's good about this kit?  First off, its a kit thats easy to use, well designed and constructed, and contains all the bits an pieces you'll need (other than the USB cables specific to your devices).  As the panel is small and sunlight varies in strength the panel itself won't always consistently charge or power devices directly - so a power pack is included to accumulate/normalize/amplify that power and also make it available to USB devices when the sun isn't out.  And it doubles as a battery charger for AA or AAA batteries (although you have to charge 4 at a time).This is one of my favorite kits and I give it 4 stars.  Why only 4?  Well it is a bit bigger and heavier than it needs to be (see the PowerFilm AA and AA+USB units if you want the ultimate in tiny and light - but they are not as versatile).  The battery pack doesn't independently charge each battery but requires a set of 4 to charge anything.  The particular panel technology used is the most efficient in strong sunlight but in less ideal conditions it looses efficiency quickly (the PowerFilm panels are not as efficient in full sunlight but are much more efficient in less ideal conditions).I highly recommend this kit for an individual thats going to be "off grid" for a while that wants to continue to use a few small USB or AA or AAA devices.  If you have a lot of devices or want to power things for more than one person you might want to consider a bigger kit like the Sherpa 50.
summary: Great for Hiking, Camping and Emergency use of small USB or AA or AAA powered devices

I bought this to replace a Troy-bilt Trimmer purchased at Lowes. VM Innovations had good pricing, and it was shipped very fast. I've had good experiences with Huskvarna, specifically their backpack leaf blower. Product came well packaged, everything was in the box. The unit was very easy to assemble, with very little to do. It seems well built and sturdy. It started right up. It is lightweight, easy to handle, and uses very little fuel. The trimmer head comes with line thicker than most trimmers, it doesn go through as much as my past trimmer. I have several fences to trim against, including chain link. My old trim head went through a significant amount of line, this head is much more economical. The safety guard for the trimmer covers the line well but does not get n the way of trimming. The extra attachments I have for my Troy Bilt (Hedge trimmer, edger, Chainsaw) also fit on this trimmer, which is a plus. The only negative about the product I would say is that when new it doesn't seem to hold an idle really well. You have to keep on the throttle a bit to keep it running. That seems to be going away as it gets broken in.Over, this is a great trimmer to use around the yard, and a great value. Would definitiley buy from VM innovations again.

It works as described, but it took a bit of experimenting to to get the adapter sock to stay on the blower. It is a clever design, and it does work with my very powerful Toro electric leaf blower as I describe below.I use it with an electric Toro blower. The blower is powerful enough to blow the adapter sock off the tapered blower attachment. After some experimenting I found the trick to make the connection very secure. 1) Slide the sock directly over blower port (with fan guard off, and buckle unthreaded). 2) Replace the fan guard over the sock, and 3) thread the rubber strap of the sock through the guard and tighten to secure it.The whole set up is very secure. I can hold the blower pipe with both hands with the Toro hanging off the bottom to blast the leaves and junk out of the gutters. The Toro-Worx combination does blast everything out of the gutter, esp. after the second pass. Once I figured out how to use it it got my gutters all blown out in just a few minutes. Much, much easier than running up and down a ladder.The piping is a bit flimsy. But that also makes it very light weight, so it is easy to get it up to your gutters, and to work with it without undo strain. The sock adapter seems to be quite robust, but the button holding it to the pipe could be stronger.Remember to wear a hat and eye protection. Lots of stuff comes raining down on you.

I love the twist on this game to make it more challenging than the random dumb luck of Bejeweled etc.  the jewels are in side of different shapes and the shapes can spin and they can be repositioned if there is room.  the shapes disappear once each jewel in the shape has been matched.  that's the challenge, you can match all day long on some boards and still not match the spots you need.  4 levels thank goodness because you need the first level to get the hang of it. problem is once you master all 35 boards of each level (yes, 35 x 4) you will crave more boards.  all 35 boards are the same but you have less time and more gray spots to get at each level.  very, very clever.  I'm a Tetris, bonsai blast (zuma), zenerchi, type chick if that helps you get my tastes in cool games. gave it 4 stars only because I really really want more levels and or boards.

This is a fun wallpaper application for your Android phone, when it works. On my Nexus One it performs admirably but sometimes the wallpaper will cease to function leaving a black background instead. This is usually accompanied by stability issues on my phone, difficulty unlocking, non-responsiveness. For the record, I did move this to my SD card to save space (the Nexus One has precious little internal storage). Whether or not that may be the culprit is irrelevant to me because I feel that is a reasonable use case to account for. Also, The Nexus One was Google's flagship phone and successor the the G1 as a more current developer phone. Long story short, if your app doesn't work on the Nexus One you have done something wrong. I really want to like this wallpaper app but the stability is a deal breaker. I'm willing to give it a few more days and see how it pans out but without a developer update in the near future I'm going to have to ditch this app.

reviewText: I have been using Springpad for about 2 years.  It is my most used (besides email, facebook, texting).  I have added all my favorite recipes to it.  That is my favorite thing about it.  I have springpad on my computer via internet, on my Kindle, and on my phone.  They all work together.  Great to go to the kitchen with my kindle, pull up the recipe and cook from there.  If I am at the store and decide to cook something, go to the app, look up the recipe and see what I need to buy.  If Cooking Light sends me a recipe on my email and I think I may want to cook it, I spring it into the Cooking Light notebook.I also use it for planning.  For Thanksgiving, I made a notebook called Thanksgiving.  Went to find my recipes and added to the notebook.  I add a shopping list (which is amazing part of springpad too), added a checklist of things to make, added a checklist of stuff to organize and get before hand (tablecloths, napkins, etc.)  I went to NYC and made a board of everything I wanted to do.  Saved my reservation numbers, addresses of places, etc in that notebook.The best way to get to know springpad is to watch their tutorials.  You will wonder how you got along without it.  I have tried other apps like this, and this is the best.

reviewText: I saw a few complains about the app crashed on KF but I decided to give it a try anyway and it works great.  I love this game.  The introductory is good.  The graphic is great.  The music is just right. It will stay on my KF for awhile.

I've tried two other calendar apps but I didn't like their limits.  This does absolutely everything you need a calendar to do. Plus it has tasks and agenda included.  Yes for an app it is "pricey" at six bucks...Lol.  But you can't put a price on how efficient and organized it makes you.Yes it took me a while to get it set up with each view (day, week, month,year, task, and agenda) appearing with the beautiful and vibrant color combos I chose that were unique to that view.  But once you have that done it is a cinch. So many options of colors and types of reminders that it's impossible not to end up with the calendar that makes you smile every time you use it.  And you can make an entry an individual color and set that color on the color wheel so you can easily have that at the ready for the next event you want to use it for. So you don't have to have different calendars on Google to have different colors as someone else posted.One of the seamless features is that you can view it offline and add events without an internet connection and it immediately synchs to and updates your other calendars as soon as a connection is available. For the most basic math of the form A op B, this calculator is functional.  And this is, of course, what a lot of people do.However, as pointed out a few times already, any calculator which claims to have a scientific (or even business) mode and doesn't follow the correct order of operations has clearly dropped the ball.Personally, I stick with Droid48 (on the Android market) for all of my calculator needs, big and small.  It emulates an HP-48GX calculator, provides a near identical skin, and even runs the actual 48GX ROM.  It's as close to the real thing as you can get without holding the real hardware.  If you're not a fan of RPN (Reverse Polish Notation), then you probably won't like this, which is really too bad.  You should definitely try it.  It's even small!

I have amassed many apps, specifically games, and this app has made it easier to organize all of them. 

Before this, I used folders to organize games into genres since looking in the app drawer can be tedious. For whatever reason, whenever I added a new app to a folder, it's added at the end and the folder's not alphabetical anymore. I would have to put the apps in trash and re-add them every time I got a new app so that the folder's alphabetically organized.

Now, this app has saved me from all the hassle of tedious organization. Whenever you download a new app, this app will alert you to put the new app in a default category or your own customizable category, using a checklist. As a result, the app's automatically in your organized "folder." 

Essentially, this is an awesome app! Great job developers! :)

The NASA Now app works well on a Kindle Fire HD. It has been very stable for me, with no crashes or performance issues. There are LOTS of words, lots of details and links to lots of images. The screen shots on the product page give the false impression that the app shows plenty of photos/images all the time. The "Image of the Day" link leads to a _description_ of the image, which requires an extra click/tap to display; and there is no archive of previous IOTDs. Most of the information is updated several times a week (sometimes not for a day or two, then sometimes multiple times in a day). You could probably find all of this information on various NASA web sites, but this app brings it all in to one convenient place. Not bad for 99.
summary: NASA Now app works well on Kindle Fire HD

It has entertaining music, looks better because the bubbles are clearer, the backgrounds automatically change, bubbles sound better, plus you can actually learn things, as they have ABC, Math, Reading, Science, Nature, and Music topics, with free trials for all, and the paid versions only cost 99 cents; and to top it all off, if your device has a microphone, you can actually blow on the phone to blow the bubbles! If you would like to do better than this app, please check out the Bubble Pop learning games:Bubble Pop ABC,Bubble Pop Nature,Bubble Pop Math,Bubble Pop Reading,Bubble Pop Science,Bubble Pop Music,Bubble Pop Geography

reviewText: This app works and looks great on the Kindle Fire. In-Depth:Overview:Besides the basic four functions; this calculator also has the three trigonometric functions, exponents and logs, the tip calculator, a calculation history, and the standard memory feature. The app also takes advantage of the fact that it's on the tablet by letting you pick the visual theme. There are two types of themes, 3D and stranded - and each has several color schemes. The tip calculator has one 3D and one standard color schemes, and the main calculator has six 3D and eight standard color schemes. The 3D themes are what you see an example of on the icon. They look really nice on the 7" display, with crisp buttons and a calculator-like panel in the background. The standard themes switch out for just rectangular buttons on a solid background. Simple, and if you have vision problems this will make it a breeze to use, plus some of these look nice as well. I personally like the 3D themes, but I'm sure some people will like the more basic themes as well.Permissions/Performance:This app doesn't need any permissions, which is awesome. And you can easily shut it down from the app menu. No need for force-stopping.  :)Why I took off a star:1) You cannot have the advanced functions (exp, log, etc) unless you close the history panel on the bottom. Also, with all the buttons displayed, they. don't. quite. fit. on the screen. You can still use them, but it enough the scrolling is activated - a minor annoyance, but one that should have been fixed. It really is just a millimeter off from fitting the screen perfectly.2) The calculator only works from one angle. So you cannot rotate it. Again, it works fine just like it is, but I would have liked the option to use the app in landscape mode.

reviewText: If you are not familiar with the game, it it a similar type game to solitaire where cards have to be placed in sequence to build total decks - from K at the top, to 2, A at the bottom.  I've known this game for a long time but just now downloaded it to my iPhone.  It is modified from other versions I've known, to be quicker responding, and that seems to make it more fun, in so far as if you play the game at a fast pace, it can keep up with you.  Other versions do not.  I like the game a lot; it serves as an easy break when I need to "get away" for a few seconds, and can't actually go anywhere.  And I like it a lot because you don't have to rely on someone to make a move in the game before you can!
This has long been my personal favorite of the freecell genre, so to find an adroid based version was for me a real joy.  And of course on my new Kindle Fire it just purely magnificent.

I think it is a nice brain workout. Even when I just ask for a "Winning" hand, one still has to do the right things. Sometimes like in Mahjong, the "Hint" can help out. And you can skip the adds by touching the bottom of the screen (sometimes the top left "x").
If you love solitaire, you'll like this game. It's fun and addicting and really passes the time when you're waiting or just want to wind down at night.

UPDATE 9/30/2013. Last evening I began to play Words with 20 "Friends" and what do you know!!! Another change was made by the good fellas at Zynga. Now, with each game played, my Kindle gets a weird ad's video screen -- then Kindle proceeds to shut down and reboot.  DO YOU KNOW HOW AGGRAVATING THAT IS? While you're raking in the money for these ads, your loyal users are fleeing.UPDATE 7/17/2013: Early this morning I opened Kindle to play Words with Friends... to find an amazing improvement!! The game was revised, again, for the better! It's calculating word points again. That was a great revision, which began earlier this year, and was taken away earlier this month, and, the screen that was dropping down showing three other games to be played suddenly went away a few days ago. Maybe someone at Zynga is actually playing the game and reading our reviews. KUDOS!! I revised my review from TWO stars to FOUR stars (gotta do something about those pesky ads, especially the new video ones).Really Zynga??? 7/4/2013I turned on Words with Friends this morning and it jammed up my Kindle Fire -- again. I was getting used to that issue, but, then, after rebooting Kindle, a whole new Words with Friends version appeared.  No questions asked. Here ya go... it's Updated!  What a mess!! I'm currently playing 20 games with Friends, or maybe not.  Does Zynga's employees even play with this game on a daily basis??  I've got 20 games that just slowed down to a crawl, because I'll need to add up points all over the screen to find the best score for playing each time. Then the new screens showing me who I can play with prior to going back to the main screen. This is not a highway where I want to know what exits are coming up. The prior version's screens were doable. Who was this update created for?  As I said before.. Really Zynga?? Why not ask a panel of players before throwing these changes at loyal players.
summary: Really Zynga... what's up with you guys????

UPDATED REVIEW (1/30/13)I just went online and saw the note saying they'd fixed the problems.  I just tested my Kindle app and IT'S WORKING!!! CHEERS!OLD REVIEW FROM BACK IN DECEMBER 2012I just started playing Scrabble on my new Samsung Galaxy S3 in December 2012 but after only 24 hours that stopped working properly on my phone.  I literally can't play AT ALL through my phone or the Kindle.  The only way for a while I could play with friends I started games with was through the Facebook Scrabble feature.  The downfall to that is it doesn't have the teacher function (super helpful) and of course then I can't play while I'm on the fly.When I saw that there was a Kindle version I was pretty stoked since I already have the Kindle.  I paid money to upload it and it's never worked; not even once.  I'm trying hard to keep the faith there's something that can be done to make this work again not only on the paid version of my Kindle, but also on my Samsung phone.  It was a lot of fun for a short period of time and got me in better touch with some of my friends I hardly talk with.  If anyone has advice on how to get my Kindle and phone to work with this app again I'm all ears.  I thought paying for it would be the solution to the problem but I was VERY wrong.  Seriously bummed out...

reviewText: Kindle Fire runs a modified Android Gingerbread.  One of the ways the Kindle Fire is different from most Android devices is it does not have the Google Android Marketplace; instead apps must be obtained through Amazon's own app store.  As of this writing, the DropBox app is not available in the Amazon App Store, but I was able to get it installed on my Kindle Fire anyway with the following steps:'Click the gear icon in the top-right corner of the Kindle Fire home screen to activate the Settings window'Click More'Scroll down to Device'Scroll down to `Allow Installation of Applications from Unknown Sources' and move the slider from `Off' to `On'You'll be prompted to confirm you mean to do this; you agreee'Switch to the Kindle web browser and go to [...], and click Download App.  This will download the Dropbox .apk file'When the download is finished you'll see a notification in the top left corner.  Click it and scroll down to the notification that the download of the Dropbox .apk file is complete.  Click the file.'You will be prompted to install the application.  Click the button'Once installation is completed, start the Dropbox application and log in.'Done!Hope this helps someone. God bless.

This is the best multiplication app i have seen. Since i am going to the next grade, i thought it would be good if i practiced my facts for 5th grade. This app not only teaches you your facts, but it helps you on your speed. With me, i can do my multiplication and division facts really quick thanks to this app. This app does your multiplication facts from 0 to 12. It gives you a calculator to put your answer in. It even reads you the question. There is a mute button to turn the talk off, there is a help button for you to see the correct answer, there is a next button to go to another question and there is a delete button to change your answer before you submit it. I would recommend this app to kids and people who want to learn and speed up how fast they can do multiplication. Its like everybody says, "If you can do multiplication, you can do division." This app believe it or not teaches you division too. This is a really great multiplication app!!! If i were you, i would get this app right away. ;) Good luck and Have fun!!!

I have worked with a scientific calculator for over 30 years.  The worst was a standard entry calculator with extra functions and memory.  The best that I used was reverse polish entry with double function keys, multiple levels of memory, and was programmable.  I don't expect that level of machine for free, but on a $200.00 hand held I do expect an app advertised as scientific to be more than a check book insert.  If it's basic, then tell people it's basic, and that they can upgrade to a REAL SCIENTIFIC CALCULATOR for a small fee, and then you can extol it's advanced features.

That doesn't make any sense at all.  The result is very unpredictable controls.

I will say this upfront: I love this game, and have loved it for years.  I used to play it on our barely internet-enabled computers in middle school when I was able to scam my way out of doing homework. this was one of my first games I ever played on the Internet, and as a result it will always have a place in my heart.That all having been said, objectively this game is beginning to show its age; after all, it was developed (initially) for Windows 3.  The music in this version isn't bad, but the "go" sound effect felt unnecessary, since I was the one actually starting the level.  Furthermore, while this game is a wonderful match for touch-screen devices in terms of controls, the overall gameplay is so simple as to be potentially annoying to some players.Again, I loved this game and probably always will, but it's not for everyone.
summary: A good game, if a bit dated.

I'm playing on a 7" HTC View which is great size for reading, but wish for a little larger screen for Total Pool.  I'm an old fart and haven't played on a real pool table for years, but as for realism I have to say this game is very good as I'm just as bad a shooter now as I was back then.  I started playing Total Pool with my index finger, but found a short stylus pen is MUCH better for both viewing the table and improving shooting accuracy.  With finger I got a LOT of frustrating miscued accidental shots.  With the stylus much less.I spent the first week on challenges.  Now I'm playing "8" ball.  As bad as I am my built-in opponent is worse.  I win about 75% games at the easiest level.While my shooting skills are frustrating I'm still motivated to get better.  I enjoy the realistic action of the game, the ball movements with English, etc.  I like the graphic and audio qualities.  The balls are high def sharp edged accurate in size, color, and motion.  Ball cracking sounds are good to my partial deaf ears and I do like the background music played low.I usually spend a lot of time reading.  Now that I'm hooked on Total Pool a lot less reading.

How do they do it?  Another 58 puzzles for a dollar?  That's an absurd bargain!  The puzzles have gotten harder too!  Some of the pictures feature a rainbow of colors all over the board.  Others have tiles that appear to fit into multiple places!  Still, others have complex but repeating patterns.In short, this expansion pack will keep you busy for quite a while.  On medium, I averaged 15-30 minutes per puzzle.Some of the more notable puzzles:1)  Clover -- multiple clovers all over the board.  Tiles for one clover appear to fit into other clovers!2)  Eggs and Cartons - This one has two eggs of similar color!  The egg you think should be on the right side of the board should actually be on the left!3)  Purple Crocuses - Instead of a variety of colors, there are just three...but that makes things harder!4)  Ribbon - A tangle of colored ribbons that curl into all directions.5)  Egg Shaped Biscuits -- only a few colors but a variety of patterns.I could go on and on.  This Spring Pack is jammed with complex and challenging puzzles.  It's a winner.
summary: The best just gets better...and harder!

I've been looking for a good calculator for my Fire, and have gone through several trying to find the perfect one.  I think the perfect calculator is a very personal thing, depending mostly on what one does with a calculator.  I just want to be able to do basic stuff, the few times I need to do more than I can do in my head (like splitting restaurant bills when I've had a glass of wine).Well, I think I found my keeper in Calculator Plus Free (Kindle Fire Edition)It's attractive, bright, has full screen keys and an easy to read results display.You can copy your result by pressing and holding on the main part of the results display (or paste a number into the app by the same method).To calculate a tip, enter the item cost, then + the per cent and tap =.  37 + 25%The result, 46.25 will show in the top of the display and the breakdown 37 + 9.25 will be shown below.  Easy peasy for entering into credit card charge slips.It has a memory "tape" where you can see past calculations--tap on the lower part of the results display.  You can clear the history or just close the tape after viewing.  A tape is one of "must haves."There's also a paid versionCalculator Plus (Kindle Fire Edition)for $0.99 which removes the ads.  The ads are very unobtrusive, in a narrow band at the top, but if that bothers you, $0.99 for this very nice calculator is not too much.  I thought about buying the ad-free version just to support the company, I like it that much, but instead opted to buy theFraction Calculator (Kindle Fire Edition)by the same company.  As a quilter, I add fractions and divide them quite often, and while I know the decimal equivalents of 1/8 and larger, I have to think about the others and if it's 5/8 or 7/16, forgettaboutit!  :DLovely calculator app, thanks!

This app doesn't only work amazingly but it also always there for you and is way easier than going nonlinear and finding a calculator on the Internet. This app is so awesome and I definetely reccomend it especially because it is free!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Finally!  A no-nonsense calculator with some down-to earth extras.  Of course it can add and subtract.  Of course it is easy and intuitive to use.  Of course it works.  But it also allows you to backspace if you make an error entering a number.  And it shows the interim calculations when performing a percentage.  This is helpful to me when I calculate a sales receipt and have to itemize the sales tax.  The ads are non-obtrusive.  If you want a great basic calculator, this is it!

reviewText: I downloaded this app for my Droid about a year ago.  I give it high marks for several reasons:1.  It is easy to use2. You must create a user/pass and log-in3. You can have it alert you on monthly refills4. You can scan your Rx to input5. You can simply use your history to refill. Out of refills? I just submit a few days in advance to allow the pharmacy to contact my  doctor.6. If I ever have to fill out paperwork regarding meds currently being taken, I just launch the app to provide me the information7. If you are travelling, you can use your GPS to locate the nearest Walgreens to request your refill.8. You can use the app to scan your loyalty card at the checkoutIn sum, it is free and convenient.

It's like the Risk game you've always played in the sense that you do play it the same way. You get to pick your countries and once all the countries are claimed, you can build up your armies wherever you want and plot how you're going to take over the world.Your plans, however, are almost always foiled by the ai. Because no matter if you've got 20 armies taking on a country with two armies or if you're a country of 20 armies and the ai is attacking you from a country of four armies, you're going to lose about 75% of the time.I have had times where I've had 20+ guys on my country and attacked a country with five or six guys. I lost. And I didn't just lose by a little - I lost every single dude on my country while the ai didn't lose a single person. This happens the other way around as well. The ai will attack my country of 20+ guys with its country of seven guys and I'll lose all my guys before the ai loses one.It would be okay if this happened every now and then because, as I'm sure we all remember, flukes DID happen when we played the board game. But that's what they were - flukes. With this game, it's the norm. The flukes here are when you have 20 guys attacking a country of five guys and you win.After playing this game several dozen times, unfortunately I had to change my review to one star. More than 75 percent of the time, when I was attacking the AI with less than half the number of armies I had or when the AI was attacking me with less than half the armies I had, I lost. And I didn't just lose by a little, I lost by A LOT. I attacked a country, 19 armies on my country, 4 on the AI's country. I lost. The AI? Didn't lose a single army. This has happened so many times that the game is practically unplayable. It's a shame, because I love Risk, but this game fails miserably.

First of all I would have rated this game 5 stars based on the creativity, fun and somewhat challenging games and puzzles but I only gave it 2 stars primarily due to the limited awarding of the orbs.  Due to the stingy number of orbs, you have to play the games over and over and over and over again not letting you opt out of a particulatrly punishing puzzle(s).  For example, in the puzzle requiring you to tilt your tablet, for whatever reason when I would tilt my tablet to get the ball to move around the table it would always go off te board the opposite way I was tilting the tablet or simply not move.  I knew how to solve the puzzle but due to this flaw I had to use the orb for these puzzles.  It states you get an orb after each chapter -- not true.  Also, I don't much like the punishment for tapping on an I item in the games, again just another way to punish you and force you to replay that entire game, if you had to use the orb it would start over but not reinstate your orb. Frustrating!!!! Big Fish - games are supposed to be fun - and not feel as though you were being relentlessly flogged - really not fun!

This is kind of fun the first time you play it, but you end up doing the same thing each time, just driving a car and mowing down pedestrian zombies, occasionally you might not get close enough to hit one and it will jump on your car then you've got to swipe something with the side of your car so it gets knocked off.  The only variety is when you get to a certain part past the one mile mark you get some sort of lottery thing happen, occasionally this is a gun which appears on your roof, then you can shoot the pedestrian zombies.  The graphics are okay but again you're seeing the same scenery and zombies each time.  While free (I wouldn't pay money for it) you might as well download it, but if you're concerned for space on your Fire, you'll probably put it back to store in your cloud shortly after and maybe download it to your device again in a year or so and play it a few times and repeat the procedure.  It just doesn't have the variety to keep it on your device.  You don't have to be connected to Wi-Fi to play this though, at least it has that.
summary: It's Okay But Not Much Variety in What You Do Each Time

I'm using this app on a 1st gen Kindle Fire.Pros:- Pretty good selection of sites to choose from- 360 degree rotation makes it easy prop up with my Kindle case while charging and to avoid the accidentally putting it to sleepCons:- Insufficient text size control; i.e.; these old eyes need more help reading the fine print. Sometimes using the "full site" option mitigates the problem, but not always.- Town Hall loads but as soon as one article has been read, trying to read another article fails. The next article will appear while loading but when the animated icon quits spinning, a blank page with ads at top and bottom is all that's there. If I delete the cache and data associated with the app, I can read another article, but the app should work without such intervention.
summary: Town Hall portion does not work

I was very excited about being able to leverage the Nest Thermostat as I am technical and thought the Nest Protect was a solid awesome product and concept.  My system is very basic heating, so thought compatibility would be a no brainer, which I verified with the online guidance prior to purchasing.On receipt of the Nest, I installed and received Power error codes, called the support team who advised on modifying the wire connections which still did not work.  Called back in and they sent out a replacement connection plate, which I truly did not believe would correct the problem.  Sure enough it did not, and they then wanted to send out a whole new unit, resulting in almost 6 days without a thermostat....at that point I was convinced that the unit was just incompatible and am moving on to other options.
